Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and very faint traces of eight lines of Coptic or Greek text.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393428) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393428)
